pages.title: Control Rod
pages.text: Control Rods can be inserted into their respective $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-fuelrod)Fuel Rods$(/l) pile and are made of a material that can absorb the neutron radiation that will otherwise hit the reactants stored in the $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-fuelrod)Fuel Rods$(/l), slowing down or stopping the consumption of fuel and the generation of heat and waste.

Right click on a Control Rod to open its graphical user interface.$(br2)In the interface you could assign a name to the Control Rod that can later be used to reference this specific Control Rod while using the $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-computerport)Computer Port$(/l) to manage the Reactor.$(br2)The insertion percentage specify how much the Control Rod is inserted into it's $(l:bigreactors:reactor/part-fuelrod)Fuel Rod$(/l) pile. You can change the value for only this Control Rods or for all of them.
$(l)Mandatory:$() yes$(br)$(l)Valid positions:$() all on a single face, following a Fuel Rod$(br)$(l)Variants:$() all$(br)$(l)Graphical interface:$() yes
